ca.cgjennings.apps.arkham.editors

Class SimpleCollectionParser

  • java.lang.Object
    • ca.cgjennings.apps.arkham.editors.SimpleCollectionParser

  • public class SimpleCollectionParser
extends Object
    A parser that creates simple collections for the APIBrowser based on collections of Web pages. The basic format is the same as other setting files. A collection file can contain property definitions, package definitions, and document definitions. A property definition is a key, value pair that changes a parser setting or an overall property of the collection, such as its name. A package definition is a line that starts with '+'. It changes the package that subsequent documents are assigned to. A document definition consists of a URL key and an optional title value. The key is combined with the current base URL to define the location of the document. The title of the document is taken from the value, or inferred from the document location if no title is provided.

    The following property definitions are currently recognized:

    base-url
    Changes the base URL that documents are assumed to be relative to.
    name
    Changes the name of the collection.
    icon
    Uses the specified image resource as an icon for the collection.
    suffix
    Sets a suffix added to the end of subsequent document locations, such as ".html".
    sort
    A boolean value that indicates whether the nodes of the tree should be sorted.
    shorten-packages
    A boolean value that indicates whether package nodes should show only the part of the name after the final dot.
    priority
    An optional integer value that can be used to group together related collections. (The default group is 0.)

    Properties, package names, and title names generally support value replacement. This means that values that start with '@', '#', or '$' will be replaced using a UI language string, game language string, or user setting (respectively), similar to the special variables supported by the script engine.

    A simple example: 

     # Comment line
 name = Example
 base-url = http://domain.com
 
 # A package with two documents, Introduction and Download
 +Package 1
 index.html = Introduction
 Download.html
 ...
    Since:
    3.0

    • Method Detail

      • createCollection

        public APIBrowser.Collection createCollection()
        Returns a new collection using the documents specified by the parsed collection files. The collection can be added to the Document Browser using APIBrowser.registerCollection(ca.cgjennings.apps.arkham.editors.APIBrowser.Collection).
        Returns:
        a new collection generated from the parsed files

        public String getName()
        Returns the name of the collection.
        Returns:
        the current name; names that start with '@' will be looked up first
        See Also:
        setName(java.lang.String)

      • parseBaseURL

        protected URL parseBaseURL(String value)
        Subclasses may customize how a base document URL is generated from the base-url property by overriding this method. The default implementation returns the value as a URL, after performing value replacement.
        Parameters:
        value - the property value
        Returns:
        the URL to use as the document base

      • parseDocumentLoction

        protected String parseDocumentLoction(URL baseURL,
                                      String key,
                                      String value)
        Subclasses may customize how a document's location is generated from a document line by overriding this method. The default implementation returns the key unchanged if the base URL is null, and otherwise tries to compose the base URL with the key and returns the result as a string.
        Parameters:
        baseURL - the current base URL (may be null)
        key - the key part of the document entry
        value - the value part of the document entry
        Returns:
        the location of the document, as it will appear in the address bar

      • parseDocumentTitle

        protected String parseDocumentTitle(String key,
                                    String value)
        Subclasses may customize how a document's title is generated from a document line by overriding this method. The default implementation will return the value if it is defined (after performing value replacement on it). If no value is defined, then a title is generated from the key. The default title will consist of everything in the key after the last '/' (if any), and up to the first subsequent ".html" (if any). If the title contains underscores, they are replaced with spaces. For example, the key "section/subsection/Document_Title.html" would have the generated title "Document Title".
        Parameters:
        key - the key part of the document entry
        value - the value part of the document entry (may be empty)
        Returns:
        the title to display in the document list

      • parsePackageName

        protected String parsePackageName(String packageName)
        Subclasses may customize how a package name is generated from a package entry by overriding this method. The default implementation returns the value after performing value replacement.
        Parameters:
        packageName - the package name value, without leading '+'
        Returns:
        the package name to use

      • reset

        public void reset()
        Clears the list of generated documents. The next call to a parse method will start a new document collection instead of appending to the current collection.

      • setName

        public void setName(String name)
        Sets the name of the collection. The name can also be set from within a collection file using the "name" property. Value replacement will be performed on the name.
        Parameters:
        name - the name to set
